definition: lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
distinct/clear/orderly/pain/suffering/deciduous bush used in Chinese medicine (genus Vitex)/punishment cane (old)

as rivers Jing and Wei separate clearly (idiom)/to be entirely different
lit. hunting deer in the Central Plain (idiom)/fig. to attempt to seize the throne

to play go, chess etc

to contend for hegemony/a power struggle
fire beacon (used as alarm signal over long distance)
to be evenly matched/to meet one's match
